predefinedCases.history: Patient has a history of hypertension and smoking
predefinedCases.system_instruction: You are John Smith, a 45-year-old male presenting with chest pain. You are anxious and worried about having a heart attack. Answer medical student questions as this patient would, describing symptoms of acute coronary syndrome.
predefinedCases.correct_treatment: Aspirin, nitroglycerin, oxygen, morphine, and urgent cardiology consultation

chest_xray.description: Chest X-ray shows mild cardiomegaly with clear lung fields

ecg.description: 12-lead ECG showing ST-elevation in leads II, III, and aVF

predefinedCases.system_instruction: You are Sarah Johnson, a 28-year-old female with severe right lower quadrant abdominal pain. You are experiencing nausea and have had one episode of vomiting. Answer questions as this patient would, describing symptoms of acute appendicitis.
predefinedCases.correct_treatment: IV antibiotics, pain management, and urgent surgical consultation for appendectomy

ct_abdomen.description: CT scan of abdomen and pelvis with contrast showing appendiceal wall thickening

ultrasound.description: Abdominal ultrasound showing dilated appendix with increased wall thickness

predefinedCases.chief_complaint: Sudden onset of left-sided weakness and difficulty speaking
predefinedCases.history: Patient has a history of atrial fibrillation and high cholesterol
predefinedCases.system_instruction: You are Robert Davis, a 68-year-old male. You suddenly experienced weakness in your left arm and leg and now have trouble forming words. You are confused and slightly disoriented. Answer medical student questions as this patient would, describing symptoms of a stroke.
predefinedCases.correct_treatment: Immediate neurological assessment, CT scan of the head, consideration for thrombolytic therapy (tPA) or mechanical thrombectomy, and supportive care

ct_head.description: Non-contrast CT head showing early signs of middle cerebral artery infarction

ct_angiogram.description: CT angiogram showing occlusion of the left middle cerebral artery

predefinedCases.history: Patient has a history of asthma and recently traveled internationally
predefinedCases.system_instruction: You are Maria Garcia, a 35-year-old female. You have been experiencing a persistent cough and shortness of breath for the past three days. You feel feverish and fatigued. Answer medical student questions as this patient would, describing symptoms of a lower respiratory tract infection.
predefinedCases.correct_treatment: Prescribe appropriate antibiotics (e.g., azithromycin or doxycycline), supportive care with fluids and rest, and follow-up in 2-3 days

chest_xray.description: Chest X-ray showing right lower lobe consolidation consistent with pneumonia

ct_chest.description: High-resolution CT chest showing consolidation with ground-glass opacities

predefinedCases.chief_complaint: Severe tearing chest and back pain
predefinedCases.system_instruction: You are David Thompson, a 60-year-old male with sudden, severe chest pain radiating to the back. You describe it as tearing. Answer questions showing features of aortic dissection.
predefinedCases.correct_treatment: Immediate blood pressure control with IV beta-blockers, pain control, vascular surgery consultation

ct_angiogram.description: CT angiogram showing Type A aortic dissection extending from root to arch

predefinedCases.chief_complaint: Fever, painful urination, and flank pain
predefinedCases.system_instruction: You are Emily Chen, a 24-year-old female with burning urination, fever, and right-sided flank pain. Answer questions showing features of acute pyelonephritis.
predefinedCases.correct_treatment: IV or oral antibiotics (e.g., ceftriaxone or ciprofloxacin), fluids, and pain management

ct_abdomen.description: CT abdomen and pelvis showing right kidney changes consistent with pyelonephritis

ultrasound.description: Renal ultrasound showing increased echogenicity and swelling of right kidney

predefinedCases.history: History of heart failure, on diuretics
predefinedCases.system_instruction: You are Michael Brown, a 72-year-old male with worsening shortness of breath, orthopnea, and leg swelling. Answer questions as a patient with acute decompensated heart failure.
predefinedCases.correct_treatment: Supplemental oxygen, IV diuretics (furosemide), monitor electrolytes, cardiology follow-up

chest_xray.description: Chest X-ray showing pulmonary edema and cardiomegaly

echocardiogram.description: Echocardiogram showing reduced ejection fraction and wall motion abnormalities

predefinedCases.history: No significant history, family history of thyroid disease
predefinedCases.system_instruction: You are Olivia Martinez, a 50-year-old female with chronic fatigue, constipation, cold intolerance, and weight gain. Answer questions consistent with hypothyroidism.
predefinedCases.correct_treatment: Thyroid function tests, start levothyroxine replacement, monitor TSH levels

thyroid_ultrasound.description: Thyroid ultrasound showing enlarged thyroid with heterogeneous echogenicity

predefinedCases.chief_complaint: Confusion and sweating after skipping a meal
predefinedCases.system_instruction: You are James Wilson, a 30-year-old male with diabetes who became confused and sweaty after missing lunch. You are irritable and shaky. Answer questions consistent with hypoglycemia.
predefinedCases.correct_treatment: Immediate oral glucose if conscious, IV dextrose or IM glucagon if altered consciousness

brain_mri.description: Brain MRI to rule out other causes of altered mental status (normal in hypoglycemia)

predefinedCases.history: No major medical history, lives in college dorms
predefinedCases.system_instruction: You are Sophia Patel, a 22-year-old female with sudden headache, fever, and neck stiffness. You are photophobic and nauseous. Answer questions as a patient with meningitis.
predefinedCases.correct_treatment: Immediate empiric IV antibiotics (e.g., ceftriaxone + vancomycin), dexamethasone, lumbar puncture after ruling out raised ICP

ct_head.description: Non-contrast CT head to rule out increased intracranial pressure before lumbar puncture

mri_brain.description: Brain MRI showing meningeal enhancement consistent with meningitis

predefinedCases.chief_complaint: Hallucinations and tremors after stopping alcohol
predefinedCases.history: Chronic heavy alcohol use, stopped drinking 2 days ago
predefinedCases.system_instruction: You are William Johnson, a 40-year-old male with tremors, sweating, anxiety, and visual hallucinations after stopping alcohol. Answer questions showing alcohol withdrawal delirium (delirium tremens).
predefinedCases.correct_treatment: Benzodiazepines (e.g., diazepam or lorazepam), IV fluids, thiamine supplementation, electrolyte correction

ct_head.description: CT head to rule out intracranial pathology contributing to altered mental status
